headline: ‘You Can’t Just Start Shooting Anything You Want’
abstract: Military attacks against cultural sites are against international law, and the United States has condemned the Islamic State and Taliban for similar destruction.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — More than 2,300 years ago, the Persian capital of Persepolis was burned by a foreign warrior in a fatal blow to the empire and its rich heritage. The ruins of the ancient city, in modern-day southwest Iran, could now be on President Trump’s target list of 52 sites he has threatened to attack as tensions escalated between Washington and Tehran.
